TopicTitle: Part request: Add a doorless inline clamp-o-tron

Articles.Content:
With the (fantastic) MK2 cargo bay, it is now possible to stick an inline docking port inside the cargo bay, as was done on the Space Shuttle. I tested this extensively last night with great success, but unfortunately, when you open the docking port, the doors bang into the cargo bay walls.

It still works, and you can dock, but it wiggles around alarmingly when the docking ring doors open, and I suspect it might snap the part off some day. If a second inline clampotron were made, this time with the doors simply removed leaving everything else on the part exactly the same, this would solve the problem. Just a thought.
Great idea, but this could be simplified down more to being a Tweakable option rather than a whole other part. Gotta keep that stock part count low!
Maybe the doors on the current inline docking port could be made to fold or slide back instead of opening, so they don't clip the cargo bay walls.
Why not use the cargo bay with the built in docking port?
